intro: Gonostegia bracteata, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense, velvety pubescence. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are often surrounded by bracts. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Gonostegia bracteata is often found in disturbed habitats and can become invasive in certain areas.
